subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Therefore God exalted Him to the highest place and gave Him a name that is above every name. that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow. (Philippians 2:9, 10)
reflection: If I had but one name to remember, whose would it be? Paul reminds me clearly, he says, "Jesus." In fact, he says that Jesus' name is above every name. And because of what Jesus has done every knee should bow. . What has He done? Because of His work I can be God's child and live with Him forever. YES His name is above every name. He's my only Savior.
prayer: Dear Lord, in Your mercy, write my name next to the name of Your Son in Your book of life. Amen.
original_content:
06/02/2010~~~food for thought~~~DON'T EVER FORGET HIS NAME...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Therefore God exalted Him to the highest place and gave Him a name that
is above every name. that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow. (Phil. 2:9, 10)

Our Lesson for Today:
If I had but one name to remember, whose would it be? Paul reminds me clearly, 
he says, "Jesus." In fact, he says that Jesus' name is above every name. And 
because of what Jesus has done every knee should bow....

What has He done? Because of His work I can be God's child and live with Him forever.
YES His name is above every name. He's my only Savior...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, in Your mercy, write my name next to the name
of Your Son in Your book of life...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blest us in the heavenly realms with every spiritual blessing in Christ. (Eph. 1:3)
reflection: "Who has blest us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly realms" means that in Christ we have all the benefits of ~ knowing God ~ being chosen for salvation ~ being adopted as His Children ~ forgiveness ~ insight ~ the gifts of the spirit ~ power to do God's will ~ the hope of living forever with Christ. If we have an intimate relationship with Christ, we can enjoy these blessings now. The "heavenly realms" means these blessings are eternal, not temporal. These blessings come from Christ's spiritual realm.
prayer: Dear Lord, give me the hand of faith to receive and use Your blessings faithfully. Amen.
original_content:
06/03/2010~~~food for thought~~~MY GIFT CERTIFICATE FROM GOD

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,
who has blest us in the heavenly realms with every spiritual
blessing in Christ...(Eph. 1:3) 

Our Lesson for Today;
"Who has blest us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly realms"
means that in Christ we have all the benefits of ~ knowing God ~ being chosen
for salvation ~ being adopted as His Children ~ forgiveness ~ insight ~ the
gifts of the spirit ~ power to do God's will ~ the hope of living forever with
Christ...

If we have an intimate relationship with Christ, we can enjoy these blessings now.
The "heavenly realms" means these blessings are eternal, not temporal. These
blessings come from Christ's spiritual realm...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, give me the hand of faith to receive and use Your
blessings faithfully...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to he father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For it is by grace you have been saved, through faith ~ and this is not from yourselves, it is the gift of God ~ not by works, so that no one can boast. (Eph. 2:8, 9)
reflection: How often have you heard the question, "How do I get to heaven?" That's not only a good question to ask but one for which there is only one answer. Paul sums up the answer with one word "grace." ~ God's grace is something completely undeserved, something I in no way earn or have coming. It is God's free gift. Paul emphasizes this by writing, "By grace you have been saved." It's not something I do but something done for me by God, through Christ Jesus' death on the cross. And just so I can't miss it he adds, "No one can boast." All praise belongs to God for my salvation.
prayer: Gracious Lord Jesus, I humbly thank You for Your gift of salvation. Help me treasure it always. Amen.
original_content:
06/04/2010~~~GOD'S GRACE ALONE

Our Bible Verses for Today:
For it is by grace you have been saved, through faith ~ and this is not from 
yourselves, it is the gift of God ~ not by works, so that no one can boast. (Eph. 2:8, 9)

Our lesson for Today:
How often have you heard the question, "How do I get to heaven?" That's not only a good
question to ask but one for which there is only one answer...

Paul sums up the answer with one word "grace." ~ God's grace is something completely 
undeserved, something I in no way earn or have coming. It is God's free gift. Paul emphasizes
this by writing, "By grace you have been saved."

It's not something I do but something done for me by God, through Christ Jesus' death on 
the cross. And just so I can't miss it he adds, "No one can boast." All praise belongs to God 
for my salvation...

Prayer Suggestion:
Gracious Lord Jesus, I humbly thank You for Your gift
of salvation. Help me treasure it always...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: At that time you were ~~~ foreigners to the covenant of the promise ~~~ But now ~~~ you who were once far away have been brought near through the blood of Christ. (Eph. 2:12, 13)
reflection: When our forefathers came to this country, they needed a sponsor to guarantee financial support for them. ~ The rule was no sponsor, no entry. Our sponsor for citizenship in God's kingdom is Christ Jesus. He gave His life, 33 years of perfectly keeping all of God's laws for us. He gave His life, six hours of unimaginable torture on a cross for us. ~ Because of the life He led and the blood He shed, He is our guarantee of full citizenship in heaven. This citizenship is ours the moment the spirit works faith in Christ in our heart. There is no waiting period ~ no questions to answer. Just full-fledged citizenship in the most wonderful country of all ~~ And all because of Christ.
prayer: Dear Lord, thank You for making me a citizen of Your heaven through faith in Jesus. Amen.
original_content:
06/05/2010~~~food for thought~~~FULL FLEDGED CITIZENS...

At that time you were ~~~ foreigners to the covenant of the promise ~~~ 
But now ~~~ you who were once far away have been brought near

Our sponsor for citizenship in God's kingdom is Christ Jesus. He gave His life,
33 years of perfectly keeping all of God's laws for us...

He gave His life, six hours of unimaginable torture on a cross for us. ~ Because

There is no waiting period ~ no questions to answer. Just full-fledged citizenship

Your heaven through faith in Jesus...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For we are God's masterpiece. He has created us anew in Christ Jesus, so that we can do good things He has planned for us long ago. (Eph. 2:10)
reflection: Yes Scripture stresses that we are saved by God's grace in Christ Jesus alone, but some object, "You mean you can do what you want, sin all you please, and you're still saved?" ~~~ Sorry but that is not what Paul says. He describes the believer as "God's workmanship, created ~ To do good works." As a believer, I am a unique design of the God of all grace. He who put faith in the Savior into my heart expects me to show it in my daily life. He wants me to follow His Son's example in life, not as a cause for salvation but as a result of it. He wants me, like some child who has received a wonderful Christmas present, to throw my arms around His neck in appreciation for what I have received.
prayer: Dear Lord, Thank You for The wonderful gift of salvation. Help me use my life to thank You every day. Amen.
original_content:
06/06/2010~~~food for thought~~~SAVED BY GRACE FOR GOOD WORKS...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
For we are God's masterpiece. He has created us anew in Christ Jesus,
so that we can do good things He has planned for us long ago...(Eph. 2:10)

Our Lesson for Today:
Yes Scripture stresses that we are saved by God's grace in Christ Jesus alone,
but some object, "You mean you can do what you want, sin all you please, and 
you're still saved?" ~~~

Sorry but that is not what Paul says. He describes the believer as "God's workmanship,
created ~ To do good works." As a believer, I am a unique design of the God of 
all grace. He who put faith in the Savior into my heart expects me to show it in my
daily life.

He wants me to follow His Son's example in life, not as a cause for salvation but 
as a result of it. He wants me, like some child who has received a wonderful
Christmas present, to throw my arms around His neck in appreciation for what I
have received...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, Thank You for The wonderful gift of salvation.
Help me use my life to thank You every day...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: God made Him who had no sin to be sin for us, so that in Him we might become the righteousness of God. (II Corinthians 5:21)
reflection: Have you ever thought about the great exchange? Well when we trust in Christ, we make an exchange; He takes our sins and makes us right with God. Yes our sin was laid on Him at His crucifixion. His righteousness is given to us at our conversion. This is what Christians mean by Christ's atonement for sin. In the world, bartering works only when two people exchange goods of like value. But God offers to trade His righteousness for our sin ~ something of immeasurable worth for something completely worthless. How grateful we should be for His kindness to us.
prayer: Dear Lord, thank You for charging my sins to Jesus and crediting His righteousness to me. Amen.
original_content:
06/07/2010~~~food for thought~~~THE GREAT EXCHANGE

Our Bible Verse for Today:
God made Him who had no sin to be sin for us, so that in Him we
might become the righteousness of God...(II Cor. 5:21)

Our Lesson for Today:
Have you ever thought about the great exchange? Well when we trust in Christ,
we make an exchange; He takes our sins and makes us right with God.

Yes our sin was laid on Him at His crucifixion. His righteousness is given to us at our conversion.
This is what Christians mean by Christ's atonement for sin. In the world, bartering works only 
when two people exchange goods of like value. But God offers to trade His righteousness for 
our sin ~ something of immeasurable worth for something completely worthless...

How grateful we should be for His kindness to us...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, thank You for charging my sins to Jesus
and crediting His righteousness to me...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I always thank God for you because of His grace given you in Christ Jesus. For in Him you have been enriched in every way. (I Corinthians 1:4, 5)
reflection: I don't want to be a millionaire. I am one! ~ My bank account is nothing to brag about. My dollar and cents value is slight compared to may others. But I am rich, thanks to God's grace. What else would you call someone who has the dollars of Christ's forgiveness to cover all his or her sins? who has the priceless pearl of peace with God through Jesus' blood? who carries in the portfolio of life God's grace to enrich him or her in every way. The gift of the Savior, of the gospel through which I learn of that Savior, of faith in that Savior -all this, Paul says, is due to the grace of God in Jesus Christ.
prayer: Thank You Lord, for making me rich in Jesus. Please tighten my grip on heaven's treasures. Amen.
original_content:
06/08/2010~~~food for thought~~~WHO WANTS TO BE A MILLIONAIRE?

Our Bible Verses for Today:
I always thank God for you because of His grace given you in Christ Jesus. 
For in Him you have been enriched in every way. (I Cor. 1:4, 5)

Our Lesson for Today:
I don't want to be a millionaire. I am one! ~ My bank account is nothing to brag about.
My dollar and cents value is slight compared to may others. But I am rich, thanks to 
God's grace...

What else would you call someone who has the dollars of Christ's forgiveness to cover 
all his or her sins? who has the priceless pearl of peace with God through Jesus' blood? 
who carries in the portfolio of life God's grace to enrich him or her in every way...

The gift of the Savior, of the gospel through which I learn of that Savior, of faith in that Savior -all this, Paul says, is due to the grace of God in Jesus Christ...

Prayer Suggestion:

Please tighten my grip on heaven's treasures...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: He [God] will keep you strong to the end, so that you will be blameless on the day of our Lord Jesus Christ. (I Corinthians 1:8)
reflection: Earthly riches are so slippery. Needs in life pry them loose from our hands. falling stock markets reduce their value. Death transfers them to someone else. Spiritual millionaires can also lose the riches God has given them. Satan knows what schemes to use to flush the treasures of Christ's forgiveness from our hearts. The treasures, temptations, and trials of this world are capable crowbars in his devilish hands. With them he often succeeds in his breakingand entering attempts into a believers heart. No wonder the Lord warns us that only those who endure in faith till the end will be saved. But the Lord has a promise for us, "[I] Will keep you strong to the end, " He says. He will see to it that we can stand blameless when we step before His throne in heaven. BUT we need to stay close to the Savior through Word and sacrament. Through these means the Spirit keeps faith's fingers wrapped around God's children.
prayer: Dear Lord, don't let me lose heaven's treasures. strengthen my faith through Your Spirit's work. Amen.
original_content:
06/09/2010~~~food for thought~~~(for Wed. the 9th)

Our Bible Verse for Today:
He [God] will keep you strong to the end, so that you will be blameless
on the day of our Lord Jesus Christ... (I Cor. 1:8)

Our Lesson for Today:
Earthly riches are so slippery. Needs in life pry them loose from our hands.
falling stock markets reduce their value. Death transfers them to someone else.

Spiritual millionaires can also lose the riches God has given them. Satan knows 
what schemes to use to flush the treasures of Christ's forgiveness from our hearts.
The treasures, temptations, and trials of this world are capable crowbars in his 
devilish hands...

With them he often succeeds in his breakingand entering attempts into a believers
heart. No wonder the Lord warns us that only those who endure in faith till the end
will be saved...

But the Lord has a promise for us, "[I] Will keep you strong to the end," He says.
He will see to it that we can stand blameless when we step before His throne in
heaven. BUT we need to stay close to the Savior through Word and sacrament.
Through these means the Spirit keeps faith's fingers wrapped around God's
children...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, don't let me lose heaven's treasures.
strengthen my faith through Your Spirit's work...Amen. 
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: You were bought at a price. (I Corinthians 6:20a)
reflection: What Paul is actually saying is, "your body belongs to God." Many people say they have the right to do whatever they want with their own bodies. although they think that this is freedom, they are really enslaved to their own desires. When we become Christians, the Holy Spirit comes to live in us. SO, we no longer own our bodies. That God bought us "with a high price" refers to slaves purchased at an auction. Christ's death freed us from sin but also obligates us to His service. If you live in a building owned by someone else, you try not to violate the building rules. Because your body belongs to God, you must not violate His standards for living, or deface His property.
prayer: Dear Lord, I know that my body is Your property, help me to not violate Your building rules. Amen.
original_content:
06/11/2010~~~food for thought~~~BOUGHT AND PAID FOR BY JESUS...

You were bought at a price...(I Cor. 6:20a)

although they think that this is freedom, they are really enslaved to their own desires.
When we become Christians, the Holy Spirit comes to live in us. SO, we no longer
own our bodies...

That God bought us "with a high price" refers to slaves purchased at an auction.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: You see, at just the right time, when we were still powerless, Christ died for the ungodly. (Romans 5:6)
reflection: How often do we look at the cross on the altar and remember what it means? Do you know why it is there? ~ it is there as a reminder of what Christ has done for us. But it's so smooth and shiny ~ nothing at all like the crude wood on which the Savior was suspended between heaven and earth. It is so easy to forget the horrible cross and Christ suffering hell's pangs for the ungodly. Sometimes when I look at myself, I seem smooth and shinny also. But Paul describes us as "Ungodly". Yet God has chosen us as His coworkers. what an amazing thought.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to remember and marvel that what the Savior did ~ He did for me. Amen.
original_content:
06/12/2010~~~food for thought~~~THE WONDER OF SALVATION...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
You see, at just the right time, when we were still powerless,
Christ died for the ungodly. (Ro. 5:6)

Our Lesson for Today:
How often do we look at the cross on the altar and remember what it means?
Do you know why it is there? ~ it is there as a reminder of what Christ has done
for us...

But it's so smooth and shiny ~ nothing at all like the crude wood on which the
Savior was suspended between heaven and earth. It is so easy to forget the
horrible cross and Christ suffering hell's pangs for the ungodly...

Sometimes when I look at myself, I seem smooth and shinny also. But Paul

what an amazing thought...

Savior did ~ He did for me...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord. (Romans 6:23)
reflection: Eternal life is a gift from God ~ If it is a gift, then it is not something we have earned, nor something that must be paid back. Our salvation is a gift of God, not something of our own doing (Eph. 2:8, 9). He saved us because of His mercy, not because of any good things that we have done (Titus 3:5). Oh how much more we should accept with thanksgiving the gift that God has freely given us.
prayer: Dear Lord, don't let me lose heaven's treasures. Strengthen my faith through Your Spirit's work. Amen.
original_content:
06/13/2010~~~food for thought~~~WAGES OR GIFT?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life
in Christ Jesus our Lord...(Ro. 6:23)

Our Lesson for Today:
Eternal life is a gift from God ~ If it is a gift, then it is not something we have earned,
nor something that must be paid back.

Our salvation is a gift of God, not something of our own doing (Eph. 2:8, 9). He 
saved us because of His mercy, not because of any good things that we have 
done (Titus 3:5)...

Oh how much more we should accept with thanksgiving the gift that God has
freely given us...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, don't let me lose heaven's treasures.
Strengthen my faith through Your Spirit's work...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: What a wretched man I am! Who will rescue me from this body of death? Thanks be to God - through Jesus Christ our Lord! (Romans 7:24, 25)
reflection: This inward struggle with sin was as real to Paul as it is with us. From Paul we learn what to do about it. Whenever Paul felt lost, He would return to the beginning of his spiritual life, remembering that he had already been freed by Jesus Christ. When we feel confused and overwhelmed by sin's appeal, we need to follow Paul's example. Thank God that He has given us freedom through Jesus Christ. Today let the reality of Christ's power lift you up to real victory over sin.
prayer: Dear Lord, forgive me when my sinful flesh wins. Strengthen me for my walk as Your child. Amen.
original_content:
06/14/2010~~~food for thought~~~SAINT AND SINNER...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
What a wretched man I am! Who will rescue me from this body of death?
Thanks be to God - through Jesus Christ our Lord! (Ro. 7:24, 25)

Our Lesson for Today:
This inward struggle with sin was as real to Paul as it is with us.
From Paul we learn what to do about it. Whenever Paul felt lost, 
He would return to the beginning of his spiritual life, remembering
that he had already been freed by Jesus Christ...

When we feel confused and overwhelmed by sin's appeal, we need
to follow Paul's example. Thank God that He has given us freedom
through Jesus Christ...

Today let the reality of Christ's power lift you up to real victory over sin...

Prayer Suggestion:

Strengthen me for my walk as Your child...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to he father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Who is He that condemns? Christ Jesus, who died - more than that, who was raised to life - is at the right hand of God and is also interceding for us. (Romans 8:34)
reflection: Have you ever thought that because you aren't good enough for God, He will not save you? ~ Do you ever feel as if salvation is for everyone else but you? Then this verse is especially for you. If God gave His Son for you, He isn't going to hold back the gift of salvation. If Christ gave His life for you, He isn't going to turn around and condemn you! He will not withhold anything you need to live for Him. The book of Romans is more than a theological explanation of God's redeeming grace ~ it is a letter of comfort and confidence addressed to you.
prayer: Dear Lord, thank you for Jesus' payment for my sins and for Your resulting acquittal of me. Amen.
original_content:
06/15/2010~~~food for thought~~~OUR DEFENSE ATTORNEY

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Who is He that condemns? Christ Jesus, who died - more than that, who was 
raised to life - is at the right hand of God and is also interceding for us. (Ro. 8:34)

Our Lesson for Today:
Have you ever thought that because you aren't good enough for God, He will not 
save you? ~ Do you ever feel as if salvation is for everyone else but you? Then
this verse is especially for you...

If God gave His Son for you, He isn't going to hold back the gift of salvation.
If Christ gave His life for you, He isn't going to turn around and condemn you!
He will not withhold anything you need to live for Him...

The book of Romans is more than a theological explanation of God's redeeming
grace ~ it is a letter of comfort and confidence addressed to you...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, thank you for Jesus' payment for my sins
and for Your resulting acquittal of me...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword? ~ In all these things we overwhelmingly conquer through Him who loved us. (Romans 8:35, 37)
reflection: Paul answers his own question emphatically "No." Troubles cannot separate us from the love of Christ. In fact, because of Christ's amazing love "we are more than conquerors" in the day of trouble. The Savior's love for us is no hit-or-miss affair. It's never, "Now I love you; now I don't." It's constant in all the scenes of life. His cross is the plus sign for our life. It's the guarantee that His love that laid down His life for our salvation also will lead us in our daily life. Like some Kevlar vest, His love protects us. Though the bullets of trouble may bruise, they cannot kill us. Because of Christ's great love, we can view the problems of life as the golden twine by which He ties us closer.
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus, keep my eyes on Your cross so that I am more sure of Your love in my life. Amen.
original_content:
06/16/2010~~~food for thought~~~DON'T LET TROUBLES BECOME WEDGES...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall tribulation, 
or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or
sword? ~ In all these things we overwhelmingly conquer through 
Him who loved us...(Ro. 8:35, 37)

Our Lesson for Today:
Paul answers his own question emphatically "No."
Troubles cannot separate us from the love of Christ. In fact, because of Christ's
amazing love "we are more than conquerors" in the day of trouble...

The Savior's love for us is no hit-or-miss affair. It's never, "Now I love you; now I don't."
It's constant in all the scenes of life. His cross is the plus sign for our life. It's the 
guarantee that His love that laid down His life for our salvation also will lead us in our
daily life...

Like some Kevlar vest, His love protects us. Though the bullets of trouble may bruise, 
they cannot kill us. Because of Christ's great love, we can view the problems of life
as the golden twine by which He ties us closer...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, keep my eyes on Your cross so that 
I am more sure of Your love in my life...Amen. 

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to The father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I am convinced that neither death nor life ~ nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus. (Romans 8:38, 39)
reflection: Do you remember the catchy TV commercial they used when Super Glue came on the market? They showed a 200-some-pound football player suspended in his helmet, which was glued with Superglue to a goal post. Superglue is still going strong. ~ BUT far stronger is the glue of which Paul speaks, It's God's love for us. His love is so powerful that nothing can ever rip us loose from it. Nothing in life can do it, regardless how bad. Nothing the future can bring, regardless how bleak. Not even death, no matter how certain, we just can not be separated from God's love. ~ That love binds every believer to God for all eternity. When I look at my faith to believe all this, I again see His love, which has worked such trust in my heart.
prayer: O God, help me always to turn to Your love and trust it to work in life and death for me. Amen.
original_content:
06/17/2010~~~food for thought~~~GOD'S SUPER GLUE...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
I am convinced that neither death nor life ~ nor anything else in all creation,
will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus. (Ro. 8:38, 39)

Our Lesson for Today:
Do you remember the catchy TV commercial they used when Super Glue came on the 
market? They showed a 200-some-pound football player suspended in his helmet,
which was glued with Super-Glue to a goal post...

Super-Glue is still going strong. ~ BUT far stronger is the glue of which Paul speaks,
It's God's love for us. His love is so powerful that nothing can ever rip us loose from it.
Nothing in life can do it, regardless how bad. Nothing the future can bring, regardless
how bleak. Not even death, no matter how certain, we just can not be separated from 
God's love. ~ That love binds every believer to God for all eternity...

When I look at my faith to believe all this, I again see His love, which has worked such
trust in my heart...

Prayer Suggestion:
O God, help me always to turn to Your love and trust it to work
in life and death for me...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Then Peter said, "Silver and gold I do not have, but what I have I give you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth walk.". He jumped to his feet and began to walk. (Acts. 3:6, 8)
reflection: While praying have you ever received more than you expected? The man in our verse today was hoping for a coin and received a miracle. With our natural eye we can't even see the greatest part of the miracle. We can't see how the man's crippled heart was cleansed of sin and filled with faith. Jesus and His forgiveness, Jesus and His love, Jesus and all His name contains became the beggar's very own to have and to enjoy. No wonder he stayed close to Peter and John. He wasn't about to turn loose the ones who had brought him to the Savior ~ life's richest prize. When we hold our tin cup up to God, are we looking for the very best He has to offer? The items we need for daily life are only pocket change from God. The real money comes in the form of His forgiveness, peace, and eternal life. He drops such riches into our cup through His Word and sacraments. Through them He says again and again, "What I have, I give to you. And it's the best of all."
prayer: Dear Lord, when I have You, I have life's richest prize. Help me remember this. Amen.
original_content:
06/18/2010~~~food for thought~~~JESUS ~ LIFE'S RICHEST PRIZE

Our Bible Verses for Today:
Then Peter said, "Silver and gold I do not have, but what I have I give
you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth walk." ... He jumped to his 
feet and began to walk...(Acts. 3:6, 8)

Our Lesson for Today:
While praying have you ever received more than you expected?
The man in our verse today was hoping for a coin and received a miracle.

With our natural eye we can't even see the greatest part of the miracle.
We can't see how the man's crippled heart was cleansed of sin and 
filled with faith...

Jesus and His forgiveness, Jesus and His love, Jesus and all His name
contains became the beggar's very own to have and to enjoy. No wonder 
he stayed close to Peter and John. He wasn't about to turn loose the ones 
who had brought him to the Savior ~ life's richest prize...

When we hold our tin cup up to God, are we looking for the very best He has 
to offer? The items we need for daily life are only pocket change from God.
The real money comes in the form of His forgiveness, peace, and eternal life.
He drops such riches into our cup through His Word and sacraments. Through
them He says again and again, "What I have, I give to you. And it's the best of all."

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, when I have You, I have life's richest prize.
Help me remember this...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Let us stop going over the basics of Christianity again and again. Let us go on instead and become mature in our understanding. Surely we don't need to start all over again with the importance of turning away from evil deeds and placing our faith in God. ~ You don't need further instruction about baptism, the laying on of hands, the resurrection of the dead, and eternal judgment. (Hebrews 6:1-2)
reflection: Certain elementary teachings are essential for all believers to understand. Those basics include the importance of faith ~ the foolishness of trying to be saved by good deeds ~ the meaning of baptism and spiritual gifts ~ AND the facts of the resurrection and eternal life. To go on to maturity in our understanding, we need to move beyond (but not away from) the elementary teachings to a more complete understanding of faith. Mature Christians should be teaching new Christians the basics. THEN ~ acting on what they know, the mature will lean even more from God's Word. .
prayer: Dear Lord, help me grow beyond the basics of Christianity through a daily diet of Your Word. Amen.
original_content:
06/19/2010~~~food for thought~~~ KNOWING THE FACT...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
Let us stop going over the basics of Christianity again and again.
Let us go on instead and become mature in our understanding.
Surely we don't need to start all over again with the importance of
turning away from evil deeds and placing our faith in God. ~ You
don't need further instruction about baptism, the laying on of hands,
the resurrection of the dead, and eternal judgment. (Heb. 6:1-2)

Our Lesson for Today:
Certain elementary teachings are essential for all believers to understand.
Those basics include the importance of faith ~ the foolishness of trying to
be saved by good deeds ~ the meaning of baptism and spiritual gifts ~ AND
the facts of the resurrection and eternal life...

To go on to maturity in our understanding, we need to move beyond (but not away from)

Mature Christians should be teaching new Christians the basics. THEN ~ 
acting on what they know, the mature will lean even more from God's Word....

through a daily diet of Your Word...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The Jewish leaders began harassing Jesus for breaking the Sabbath rules. But Jesus replied, My Father never stops working, so why should I ?" (John 5:16, 17)
reflection: IF God stopped every kind of work on the Sabbath, nature would fall into chaos, and sin would overrun the world. Genesis 2:2 says that God rested on the seventh day, but this can't mean He stopped doing good. Because of His unity with God, Jesus lived as God wanted Him to live. Because of our identification with Jesus, we must honor Him and live as He wants us to. And so Jesus teaches that when to opportunity to do good presents itself, it should not be ignored, even on the Sabbath.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to always be alert to the needs of others. Amen.
original_content:
06/20/2010~~~food for thought~~~NEVER ~ NEGLECT TO DO GOOD

Our Bible Verses for Today:
The Jewish leaders began harassing Jesus for breaking the Sabbath rules.
But Jesus replied, My Father never stops working, so why should I ?"
(Jn. 5:16, 17)

Our Lesson for Today:
IF God stopped every kind of work on the Sabbath, nature would fall into chaos, 
and sin would overrun the world. Genesis 2:2 says that God rested on the
seventh day, but this can't mean He stopped doing good...

Because of His unity with God, Jesus lived as God wanted Him to live.
Because of our identification with Jesus, we must honor Him and live as 
He wants us to. And so Jesus teaches that when to opportunity to do good 
presents itself, it should not be ignored, even on the Sabbath.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to always be alert to the needs of others...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

Hey all you men, have a good, safe and happy Father's Day!!!

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Salvation is found in no one else, for there is no other name under heaven given to men by which we must be saved. (Acts 4:12)
reflection: I guess we shouldn't expect the world to be excited when it hears that only the name of Jesus brings salvation. Intellectuals in the class room and in print, if they speak about salvation at all, seek for answers in the supposed goodness of man. Yes modern day Pharisees, inside and outside the church, still point to their own works. In spite of all the failures of past centuries, they are still persistent in their errors. All our human efforts are like trying to build a stairway to heaven without steps, when God has already let down a living ladder in His Son, Jesus. Let us remember to praise God each day for His Son Jesus, so like an escalator on which we need to simply stand, holding on with the hand of faith, to be lifted up to everlasting life.
prayer: Dear Lord, for me let it be Jesus, Jesus, only Jesus when it comes to my salvation. Amen
original_content:

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul had been asked the question, "What must I do to be saved?" His answer was simply, "Believe on the Lord Jesus and you will be save." (Acts 16:30b, 31a)
reflection: Let us never forget that the Good News of the Bible is simply: "Believe in the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved." we see this repeated in (Romans 10:9: I Corinthians 12:3; Eph. 2:8, 9; Philippians 2:11; Acts 16:31). When we recognize Jesus as Lord and trust in Him with our entire life, salvation is assured to us. If you have never trusted in Jesus to save you, do so quickly.
prayer: Dear Lord, as the Savior who paid for my sins, and for the faith to trust in You, I thank You. Amen.
original_content:
06/22/2010~~~food for thought~~~A QUESTION WHICH DEMANDS AN ANSWER

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Paul had been asked the question, "What must I do to be saved?"
His answer was simply, "Believe on the Lord Jesus and you will be save."
(Acts 16:30b, 31a)

Our Lesson for Today:
Let us never forget that the Good News of the Bible is simply:
"Believe in the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved." we see this repeated
in (Ro. 10:9: I Cor. 12:3; Eph. 2:8, 9; Phil. 2:11; Acts 16:31)...

When we recognize Jesus as Lord and trust in Him with our entire life,
salvation is assured to us. If you have never trusted in Jesus to save
you, do so quickly...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, as the Savior who paid for my sins, and for the faith to trust in You, I thank You...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: These are written that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you may have life in His name. (John 20:31)
reflection: We live in an information age. The modern world of technology places before us so many facts, so much data, that no one can absorb it all. But even if we could, how would we remember it. Education's goal is not to teach us everything but to teach us how to find what we need when we need it. To understand the life and mission of Jesus more fully all we need to do is study the Gospels. John tells us that His Gospel records only a few of the many events in Jesus' life on earth. But the Good News includes everything we need to know to believe that Jesus is the Messiah, the Son of God, through whom we receive eternal life.
prayer: Dear Lord teach me to love Your sacred Word and to view my Savior there. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "No one comes to the Father except through Me." (John 14:6b)
reflection: Earthly bridges have a way of crumbling into the dust. ~ Not this one. Jesus stands till the end of time as the one way to the Father. If you want to, you can charter a boat to ferry you across the Mackinac Straits, or you can drive hundreds of miles around on land. ~ But there's no substitute for God's bridge to heaven."No one come to the Father except through Me, " Jesus said. If we want to reach the shores of heaven, we must travel Jesus as the way.
prayer: Dear Lord, show me the way to heaven. Holy Spirit keep me in faith in Jesus as the only way. Amen.
original_content:
06/24/2010~~~food for thought~~~THE WORLD'S GREATEST BRIDGE

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"No one comes to the Father except through Me." (Jn. 14:6b)

Our Lesson for Today:
Earthly bridges have a way of crumbling into the dust. ~ Not this one.
Jesus stands till the end of time as the one way to the Father...

If you want to, you can charter a boat to ferry you across the Mackinac Straits,
or you can drive hundreds of miles around on land. ~ But there's no substitute
for God's bridge to heaven. 

"No one come to the Father except through Me," Jesus said. If we want to 
reach the shores of heaven, we must travel Jesus as the way...

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I will do what the Father requires of Me, so that the world will know that I love the Father. (John 14:31)
reflection: The Father had commanded. The Son in love obeyed. We know the rest of the story. The pain of the cross and the pangs of hell, the depth of suffering and the darkness of the grave that Jesus endured in love for His Father. Oh yes and we even know more. Jesus raised from the grave by the Father. His resurrection was the Father's loud Easter "Amen" to His Son's Good Friday shout "It is finished." ~ "Well done, " His Father said."Well done because of Your love for Me and for sinners." All this Jesus did, not just out of love for His Father but also for us.
prayer: Dear Lord help me marvel at the great love that brought You down to the cross to save me. Amen.
original_content:
06/25/2010~~~food for thought~~~LOVE MADE HIM DO IT

I will do what the Father requires of Me, so that the world
will know that I love the Father. (Jn. 14:31)

Our Lesson for Today:
The Father had commanded. The Son in love obeyed. We know the rest of the story.
The pain of the cross and the pangs of hell, the depth of suffering and the darkness
of the grave that Jesus endured in love for His Father...

Oh yes and we even know more. Jesus raised from the grave by the Father. 
His resurrection was the Father's loud Easter "Amen" to His Son's Good Friday shout
"It is finished." ~ "Well done," His Father said."Well done because of Your love for 
Me and for sinners."

All this Jesus did, not just out of love for His Father but also for us...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord help me marvel at the great love that brought
You down to the cross to save me...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: He was clothed with a robe dipped in blood, and His title was the Word of God. (Revelation 19:13)
reflection: What does Jesus, the Word, show us about His Father's love? Plain and simple it shows us something that we really need to know. It shows us that our Father's heart overflows with love for us. Instead of flinging us aside in our sins as we deserve, He sent His Son to earth to tell us about His love. And He did not send Jesus only to speak but also act. Jesus dipped His robe of life into His own blood on Calvary's cross. His suffering for our sins truly displays a Father's heart that would do anything to save us. Jesus is God's love in capital letters. I can't see the living Word in person today. But I can turn to the written Word. In it I see Jesus, and in Him, my Father's heart of love.
prayer: Dear Lord, teach me to love Your sacred Word and to view my Savior there. Amen.
original_content:

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: This man welcomes sinners and eats with them. (Luke 15:2)
reflection: He didn't just eat and drink with them. He died for them. Sin is sin in God's eyes. No sin is greater than another. Though some sins are more heinous in our eyes because of their consequences on others, each sin weighs the same on God's scale. And each sin deserves the same punishment. Sin cuts the sinner off from God, it calls down His righteous anger, and condemns the sinner to an eternal hell. Jesus came to pay for all sins of every sinner. He came for those mildly dusted with sin, if ever there could be such a sin. He came for those thickly coated with sin's dirt. ~ And thank God, He also came for me!
prayer: Dear Lord, when I call You, "Friend of sinners, " it's with gratitude and praise for being my friend. Amen.
original_content:

with gratitude and praise for being my friend...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to he father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and give His life as a ransom for many. Mark 10:45
reflection: Have you ever said, "I wish I would have lived when Jesus walked the earth so I could have been feed with the five thousand?" Well guess what He's still serving today. At the baptismal font He sent His Spirit to put the sign of the cross on your heart to show that He has redeemed you. Through His Word ~ as you use it ~ He offers you the wholesome food of His forgiveness. At His communion table, He gives you His most precious body and blood with the bread and wine to assure you that His forgiveness is real and that your sins are gone. Never does He tire of serving us in these wonderful ways.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to never grow tired or bored with Your service so that one day I can sit at Your banquet table in heaven. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: You are in Christ Jesus, who has become for us wisdom from God ~ that is, our righteousness, holiness and redemption. (I Corinthians 1:30)
reflection: Are you beginning to understand why the apostle Paul calls Jesus "wisdom from God"? Jesus is our "redemption." He brought us back from sin's bondage. He is our "righteousness." His payment for our sin and His perfect keeping of God's commandments enables us to stand unafraid before the heavenly judge. He is our "holiness." When God looks at us, He no longer sees a hated sinner but His dear child. When God's grace leads us to Jesus, we're truly wise. Then we know what we need to know.
prayer: Dear Lord, teach me to know the Savior Jesus Christ. Keep teaching me till I reach heaven's shores. Amen.
original_content:
06/29/2010~~~food for thought~~~ JESUS ~ WISDOM

You are in Christ Jesus, who has become for us wisdom from God ~ 
that is, our righteousness, holiness and redemption...(I Cor. 1:30)

When God's grace leads us to Jesus, we're truly wise. 
Then we know what we need to know.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, teach me to know the Savior Jesus Christ.
Keep teaching me till I reach heaven's shores...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to The father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The bride will go where the bridegroom is. (John 3:29a)
reflection: When I try to grasp my bridegrooms love, I'm like a child trying to grab hold the whole world with two little arms. When I listen to His words of love for me, nothing else sounds so sweet. When I look forward to spending my life with Him, nothing else seems important. When I anticipate being His totally and forever in heaven my joy can only increase.
prayer: Dear Lord, thank You that I can say, "I am Yours and You are mine." Never let the wonder of Your saving love cease to amaze me. Amen.
original_content:
06/30/2010~~~food for thought~~~JESUS ~ THE BRIDEGROOM

The bride will go where the bridegroom is... (Jn. 3:29a)

Our Lesson for Today:
When I try to grasp my bridegrooms love, I'm like a child trying to grab hold
the whole world with two little arms...

When I listen to His words of love for me, nothing else sounds so sweet...

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: He brought them out of darkness and the deepest gloom and broke away their chains. (Psalms 107:14)
reflection: Sin is like an anchor chain. Each sin is a heavy link in the chain. One link is already enough to anchor me, not to some watery bottom, but to a never-ending hell. Day after day I keep sinning, adding new links to my chain. Very often I don't even feel the weight of my sins. What am I going to do? What kind of bolt cutter or acetylene torch can I use to cut through the links and cast off sin's heavy chain? I need to know! The psalmist answers. Jesus has already cut me clear form my chains of sin. God sent Him into this world to free me from guilt's despair and hell's darkness. On the cross He said of sin's payment."It is finished." From the grave He rose to show that I'm free from death, the ultimate punishment for sin. Unchained ~ that's what I am! Navel vessels still have anchor chains. But my chain of sin is gone.
prayer: Thank You Lord Jesus, for freeing me from sin's heavy weight and for heaven's glory. Amen.
original_content:

Unchained ~ that's what I am! Navel vessels still have anchor chains.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
